verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When either man or woman shall separate themselves to vow a vow of a Nazarite, to separate themselves unto the LORD:
verses.web: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: ‘When either man or woman shall make a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself to LORD,
verses.ct: "Give these instructions to the people of Israel: When a man or woman makes a special vow — the vow of a Nazirite — to set themselves apart for the LORD,

verses.kjv: He shall separate himself from wine and strong drink, and shall drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink, neither shall he drink any liquor of grapes, nor eat moist grapes, or dried.
verses.web: he shall separate himself from wine and strong drink. He shall drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of fermented drink, neither shall he drink any juice of grapes, nor eat fresh grapes or dried.
verses.ct: they must stay away from wine and any other alcoholic drink. They must not drink vinegar made from wine or from any other alcohol, and they must not drink grape juice or eat fresh or dried grapes.

verses.kjv: All the days of his separation shall he eat nothing that is made of the vine tree, from the kernels even to the husk.
verses.web: All the days of his separation he shall eat nothing that is made of the grapevine, from the seeds even to the skins.
verses.ct: For the entire time of their separation, they must not eat anything that comes from a grapevine — not even the seeds or the skins.

verses.kjv: All the days of the vow of his separation there shall no razor come upon his head: until the days be fulfilled, in the which he separateth himself unto the LORD, he shall be holy, and shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow.
verses.web: “ ‘All the days of his vow of separation no razor shall come on his head, until the days are fulfilled in which he separates himself to LORD. He shall be holy. He shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow long.
verses.ct: No razor may touch their head for the entire period of their vow. Until the days of their separation to the LORD are complete, they are to be holy, letting their hair grow long and uncut.

verses.kjv: All the days that he separateth himself unto the LORD he shall come at no dead body.
verses.web: “ ‘All the days that he separates himself to LORD he shall not go near a dead body.
verses.ct: For the entire time they are set apart for the LORD, they must not go near a dead body.

verses.kjv: He shall not make himself unclean for his father, or for his mother, for his brother, or for his sister, when they die: because the consecration of his God is upon his head.
verses.web: He shall not make himself unclean for his father, or for his mother, for his brother, or for his sister, when they die, because his separation to God is on his head.
verses.ct: Even if their own father, mother, brother, or sister dies, they must not make themselves unclean, because the sign of their consecration to God is on their head.

verses.kjv: All the days of his separation he is holy unto the LORD.
verses.web: All the days of his separation he is holy to LORD.
verses.ct: Throughout the entire period of their separation, they are holy to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And if any man die very suddenly by him, and he hath defiled the head of his consecration; then he shall shave his head in the day of his cleansing, on the seventh day shall he shave it.
verses.web: “ ‘If any man dies very suddenly beside him, and he defiles the head of his separation, then he shall shave his head in the day of his cleansing. On the seventh day he shall shave it.
verses.ct: If someone suddenly dies right next to them, defiling the hair of their consecration, they must shave their head on the day of their cleansing — they are to shave it on the 7th day.

verses.kjv: And on the eighth day he shall bring two turtles, or two young pigeons, to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:
verses.web: On the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest, to the door of the Tent of Meeting.
verses.ct: Then on the 8th day, they must bring 2 turtledoves or 2 young pigeons to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and make an atonement for him, for that he sinned by the dead, and shall hallow his head that same day.
verses.web: The priest shall offer one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and make atonement for him, because he sinned by reason of the dead, and shall make his head holy that same day.
verses.ct: The priest will sacrifice one bird as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, making atonement for the Nazirite because they were made unclean by the dead body. That same day, the priest will reconsecrate their head.

verses.kjv: And he shall consecrate unto the LORD the days of his separation, and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but the days that were before shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.
verses.web: He shall separate to LORD the days of his separation, and shall bring a male lamb a year old for a trespass offering; but the former days shall be void, because his separation was defiled.
verses.ct: They must rededicate themselves to the LORD for the full period of their separation and bring a 1-year-old male lamb as a guilt offering. The previous days don't count — they are lost, because their separation was defiled.

verses.kjv: And this is the law of the Nazarite, when the days of his separation are fulfilled: he shall be brought unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:
verses.web: “ ‘This is the law of the Nazirite: when the days of his separation are fulfilled, he shall be brought to the door of the Tent of Meeting,
verses.ct: Here is the law for the Nazirite when the period of separation is complete: they are to be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.kjv: And he shall offer his offering unto the LORD, one he lamb of the first year without blemish for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish for a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for peace offerings,
verses.web: and he shall offer his offering to LORD: one male lamb a year old without defect for a burnt offering, one ewe lamb a year old without defect for a sin offering, one ram without defect for peace offerings,
verses.ct: There they must present their offering to the LORD: a 1-year-old male lamb without any defect as a burnt offering, a 1-year-old female lamb without any defect as a sin offering, and a ram without any defect as a peace offering.

verses.kjv: And a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, and wafers of unleavened bread anointed with oil, and their meat offering, and their drink offerings.
verses.web: a basket of unleavened bread, cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil with their meal offering and their drink offerings.
verses.ct: They must also bring a basket of unleavened bread — cakes of fine flour mixed with oil and unleavened wafers spread with oil — along with the grain offerings and drink offerings that go with them.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall bring them before the LORD, and shall offer his sin offering, and his burnt offering:
verses.web: The priest shall present them before LORD, and shall offer his sin offering and his burnt offering.
verses.ct: The priest will present all of these before the LORD and sacrifice the sin offering and the burnt offering.

verses.kjv: And he shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the LORD, with the basket of unleavened bread: the priest shall offer also his meat offering, and his drink offering.
verses.web: He shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings to LORD, with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest shall offer also its meal offering and its drink offering.
verses.ct: Then he will sacrifice the ram as a peace offering to the LORD, along with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest will also present the grain offering and the drink offering.

verses.kjv: And the Nazarite shall shave the head of his separation at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall take the hair of the head of his separation, and put it in the fire which is under the sacrifice of the peace offerings.
verses.web: The Nazirite shall shave the head of his separation at the door of the Tent of Meeting, take the hair of the head of his separation, and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice of peace offerings.
verses.ct: At the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, the Nazirite will shave off the hair that was the sign of their separation. They will take that hair and place it in the fire burning under the peace offering.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall take the sodden shoulder of the ram, and one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them upon the hands of the Nazarite, after the hair of his separation is shaven:
verses.web: The priest shall take the boiled shoulder of the ram, one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and shall put them on the hands of the Nazirite after he has shaved the head of his separation;
verses.ct: After the Nazirite has shaved their head, the priest will take the boiled shoulder of the ram, one unleavened cake from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and place them in the Nazirite's hands.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before the LORD: this is holy for the priest, with the wave breast and heave shoulder: and after that the Nazarite may drink wine.
verses.web: and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before LORD. They are holy for the priest, together with the breast that is waved and the thigh that is offered. After that the Nazirite may drink wine.
verses.ct: The priest will then wave these as a wave offering before the LORD. This portion is holy and belongs to the priest, along with the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the raised offering. After this, the Nazirite may drink wine again.

verses.kjv: This is the law of the Nazarite who hath vowed, and of his offering unto the LORD for his separation, beside that that his hand shall get: according to the vow which he vowed, so he must do after the law of his separation.
verses.web: “ ‘This is the law of the Nazirite who vows and of his offering to LORD for his separation, in addition to that which he is able to afford. According to his vow which he vows, so he must do after the law of his separation.’ ”
verses.ct: This is the law for any Nazirite who makes a vow. This is the minimum offering they must bring to the LORD for their separation — though if they can afford more, they may give more. Whatever they vow, they must fulfill according to the law of their separation."

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto Aaron and unto his sons, saying, On this wise ye shall bless the children of Israel, saying unto them,
verses.web: “Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, ‘This is how you shall bless the children of Israel.’ You shall tell them,
verses.ct: "Tell Aaron and his sons: This is how you are to bless the people of Israel. Say to them:

verses.kjv: The LORD bless thee, and keep thee:
verses.web: ‘LORD bless you, and keep you.
verses.ct: 'May the LORD bless you and keep you.

verses.kjv: The LORD make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee:
verses.web: LORD make his face to shine on you, and be gracious to you.
verses.ct: May the LORD make his face shine on you and be gracious to you.

verses.kjv: The LORD lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
verses.web: LORD lift up his face toward you, and give you peace.’
verses.ct: May the LORD turn his face toward you and give you peace.'

verses.kjv: And they shall put my name upon the children of Israel; and I will bless them.
verses.web: “So they shall put my name on the children of Israel; and I will bless them.”
verses.ct: In this way, they will place my name on the people of Israel, and I will bless them."
